Description: An embalmed and mummified foetus next to the sarcophagus designed to contain it, featuring a seated king, with crook and flail; to the left, a shrivelled and mummified heart and two fingers; carved flints below and to the top right; flanked by long hooked staves to both sides; illustration to Pettigrew's "A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians" (1834) Etching
Bibliographic references: Reid 1871 / A descriptive catalogue of the works of George Cruikshank (1625)
Associated titles: A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians
